derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (also denoting length and tallness): from Latin longitudo, from longus 'long'

entry.def: The longitude of a place is its distance to the west or east of a line passing through Greenwich.

example.ex: He noted the latitude and longitude, then made a mark on the admiralty chart.
example.tran: 他记下纬度和经度，然后在航海图上做了个标记。

means.word_mean: 1. an imaginary great circle on the surface of the earth passing through the north and south poles at right angles to the equator;

jushi.english: Terrestrial longitude is measured in degrees east or west of the Greenwich meridian.
